title: First impressions (Alpha 0.1)
body:
Hey guys, just got the email today and downloaded the alpha client. I am really enjoying so far. 

The champ select is beautiful and the friends list is clean and clear. I know this is very, very early Alpha, but I am a little disappointed that clubs can't be accessed. I'm sure that will change soon :)

The chat box was a little strange to me at first, and some of it's functions still confuse me. I'm unsure if I should call it a function, or a bug, because when I message people, it ends up randomly among older messages?

https://imgur.com/5VuluPa

The "yay" is from yesterday (18/05/2016)

As for in game I notice almost no difference, except for a couple of random lag spikes which turned out to be people logging in and out.

When creating a game, I don't like that it puts me into the Summoner's Rift selection instantly. Other than that, it really is a nice looking lobby screen.

Edit: Just noticed that when I exit the "create game" lobby, the music does not stop. This is somewhat annoying, not because the music is bad, but because it doesn't fit the main screen.

On a final note, again disappointed, I can't visit my profile, set up runes and masteries, look at my latest list of games, etc. I'm sure that's not far away though, so keep up the good work :D

replies.body:
Hey and welcome to Alpha,
Make sure you report the chat randomly appearing as a bug through the ingame bug button inside the alpha client. I have seen it too.
Also, profiles will be coming next week I believe, so be ready for that. Keep in mind they are sectioning parts of the client 'out of bounds' so that we aren't overwhelmed with things to test. This is all a user test, and by doing it this way Riot are able to stay on top of things. :)
